page.title: 15HOUSING IN THE EGMERE AREA
page.content: There are few dwellings in this area. There are four{tenanted farmhouses, {twelve tenanted houses}and{twelve tied {cottages.}Only one dwelling has been in the family more than one gener- ation. The average occupation of a property is 14 years. There has been no recent development. The dwellings are in three clusters - at Quarles, at Waterden and, the largest, at Egmere. The cottages at Bunker's Hill are notable as they were among the first {prefabricated buildings.}Erected for servicemen at the wartime base, they are single storey buildings. After the war, about 30{squatters}moved into the Nissen huts, no other housing being available. Later, the huts were modernised by the Council and a rent of 7/6 per week charged. Most stayed for six to seven years until conditions became too poor.
